header: This report analyzes a 22.7-second music video edit across 20 segments. The primary objective was a high-energy sync, but significant library gaps forced a shift toward rhythmic survival.

advisor.hero: Your library is starving for energy; I had to glue this together with rhythm because the footage didn't have the teeth to land the big moments.
advisor.body: We are facing a critical shortage of medium and low energy clips, and the total absence of payoff shots is a major bottleneck. I had to prioritize relentless pacing and structural anchors just to keep the edit from collapsing under its own weight.

decision_stream.what_i_tried: I wanted a branding shot to open the edit.
decision_stream.decision: Used clip_004.mp4 because no better alternative was available in the library.

decision_stream.what_i_tried: I was looking for an atmospheric setup to establish the mood.
decision_stream.decision: Deployed as a structural anchor clip_001.mp4 to prioritize rhythmic continuity over semantic fit. This was a necessary compromise to maintain the timeline's integrity.

decision_stream.what_i_tried: I needed a high-intensity sequence covering action, speed, danger, and intensity.
decision_stream.decision: Locked in clips 005, 006, 003, and 007 because no better alternative was available in the library.

decision_stream.what_i_tried: I wanted a clear reaction shot to ground the sequence.
decision_stream.decision: Forced into the slot clip_008.mp4 to prioritize rhythmic continuity over semantic fit. I chose to keep the beat alive rather than hunt for a motif that wasn't there.

decision_stream.what_i_tried: I needed to chain together speed, failure, spectacle, detail, pursuit, and victory.
decision_stream.decision: Selected clips 009, 010, 011, 012, 014, and 015 because no better alternative was available in the library.

decision_stream.what_i_tried: I wanted to focus on survival and focus during this high-stakes section.
decision_stream.decision: Used out of necessity clips 017, 018, and 019 to prioritize rhythmic continuity over semantic fit. This sequence was built to prevent a pacing collapse despite the semantic mismatch.

decision_stream.what_i_tried: I needed to wrap up the edit with competition, intensity, and a final release.
decision_stream.decision: Used clips 020, 021, 002, and 013 because no better alternative was available in the library.

friction_log: Started with high confidence in the branding, but immediately hit a wall with the lack of atmospheric options.
Middle of the edit was a struggle as the scarcity of payoff shots forced me to lean on the beat rather than the story.
Finished with tight sync, but the final sequence feels like a compromise because the library couldn't support the intended intensity.

post_mortem.worked: The relentless pacing and teal-orange LUT created a professional, cohesive look that masks the library's energy gaps.
post_mortem.didnt: The narrative feels hollow because we are missing the action motifs and payoff shots needed to actually resolve the build-ups.

next_steps: Source more high-energy action motifs to replace the current filler segments.
Capture specific payoff shots to give the build-ups a proper narrative resolution.
Expand the selection of medium and low energy clips to avoid being forced into structural anchors.
technical: Applied a teal-orange filmic LUT to unify disparate clips and maintain visual consistency.
Executed a relentless pacing strategy to ensure the edit remained tightly synced to the music despite motif scarcity.
